page.title: 12Farming
page.content: When the Letchworth Garden City Company was founded in 1903 the intention was to surround the City by a Green Belt of farmland as well as each house having its own garden and the city itself laid out with wide tree lined streets.There are still,82 years later some 2,400 acres of farmland around the city despite a great deal of building having been done.In our area north of the city there are 800 acres put down to arable farming,farmed by the Garden City farm management,headed by Mr Salway.The crops grown are largely cereals,wheat and barley and also large ares of Oil-seed Rape which is used in the manufcture of margarine.Some peas and potatoes are also grown.
